content.description: Another classic line that goes straight up the amazing face of the Sundial. Worth the approach. Crack, knobs, plates, roof, and face climbing.
content.protection: Many slings and gear up to 2". Lots of options for protection.
content.location: Start at the main left-facing crack 15' right of the obvious "pillar" start to Playing with Matches.

climbs.name: Playing with Matches
climbs.fa: Ken Klis, Tom Slater, Coby Whitaker 8-2010

content.description:
A must-do route at Shuteye. Extremely unique and varied. Start with a pillar and get cracks, two roofs, plenty of knobs and some runnel.

P1 5.9 - 55m

Start is on the 'pillar' of rock... go under the roof on the right side of the pillar and out and up the outside face of the pillar (not hard, so if it's hard, you're doing it wrong). From the top of the pillar, you lean over to the main wall and clip a bolt.

Work up the face, leaning left from the pillar but keeping right of the gully. Pull a small roof and then follow a crack to bolt anchors under the larger roof.

P2 - 5.9 - 45m

Crux is the roof overhead with horns for protection. Climb runnel to a crack leading to the top ledge. Bolt anchor at the edge.
content.protection: 2-3 bolts, gear to 4", slings for the many knobs. Need two ropes to rap route.

content.description:
P1 - 5.7 - 45m

Climb diagonal to gain the crack leading to the big broken out section and then take knobs up and past it. Keeping the broken out section on your left. Finish with runnels to gear anchor on knobs.

P2 - 5.6 - 45m

Keep heading mostly vertical up cracks and knobs to a ledge for gear anchor.

Then traverse right to ledge for Playing with Matches and rap down its bolted anchor.
content.protection:
Gear to 3" and many slings for knobs.

Two ropes for rap down Playing with Matches.
content.location: This climb is a bit separated from the rest, to the left of the gulley. Start just under the right edge of the big broken out section on some blocks.

content.description:
A mixed route going up a fun steep face to chain anchor.

Nice route to do if you have time for one more, or as Â warm up.

Climb the "dagger" flake (or OW on right side) up past bolts using plates and knobs.
content.location: Behind a tree, look for the "dagger" flake. You can't miss it.
